item.description: I’m a PhD student in philosophy at Stockholm University. I work on semantics, philosophy of language, and formal epistemology. I’m especially interested in interrogative semantics and in the relation between beliefs/credences and questions. I started as a PhD student in February, 2019. Before this, I obtained a Master’s degree in logic from University of Amsterdam in 2018, and a Bachelor’s degree in philosophy (with a minor in linguistics) from Stockholm University in 2016.

item.title: papers
item.description: 2020 Factive islands and interrogative logical triviality. PDF Proceedings of Semantics and Linguistic Theory 30. The semantics and pragmatics of nouns in concealed questions. PDF Semantics & Pragmatics 13(7). 2019 Sortal versus relational nouns in concealed questions. Proceedings of Chicago Linguistic Society 54. Superseded by The semantics and pragmatics of nouns in concealed questions. Inquisitive logical triviality and grammar. PDF MSc thesis, University of Amsterdam. Partially superseded by Unacceptability in Yucatec Maya revisited.

item.title: talks
item.description: Selected. For a complete list, see my CV. 2021 Relevance and the aim of belief. (Tentative title.) Talk at CLLAM seminar, Stockholm University, May 2021. 2020 Delusions and other question-sensitive beliefs. Handout Talk at fifth PLM workshop on Delusions in language and mind, University of Amsterdam (on-line), October 2020. Factive islands and interrogative logical triviality. Slides Talk at SALT 30, Cornell University (on-line), August 2020. 2019 Sources of meaning-driven unacceptability.
